main

Class HttpRequest

  • java.lang.Object
    • main.HttpRequest

  • public class HttpRequest
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents an HTTP request. An instance contains the following information:

    • A request line (e.g. "GET / HTTP/1.1")
    • An HTTP method (e.g. "GET")
    • A resource path (e.g. "/index.html")
    • An HTTP version (e.g. "HTTP/1.1")
    • An associative array containing the headers (key: header field, value: header value)
    • An optional body (may be null if absent)

    Author:
    Bauwen Demol (r0583318), Jorik Jooken (r0588270)

      Constructs an HttpRequest from the given components.

    • Constructor Detail

      • HttpRequest

        public HttpRequest(java.lang.String requestLine,
                   java.lang.String method,
                   java.lang.String path,
                   java.lang.String version,
                   java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> headers,
                   java.lang.String body)
        Constructs an HttpRequest from the given components. Note: it's up to the creator of this constructor to make sure that the method, path and version given are the same as in the given request line!
        Parameters:
        requestLine - The request line (the first line of the request)
        method - The HTTP method of the request
        path - The relative resource path
        version - The HTTP version
        headers - The map containing the headers
        body - The complete body of the request. May be null, indication it has no body (e.g. when HEAD or GET request is sent)
